page.title: 09HILTON HOUSE AND BRINSOP
page.content: {Hilton House}is a linear development along the{A6}Manchester to Preston road. It consists almost entirely of terraced houses which were built for the colliers who worked in {Brinsop Pit.}This closed in the mid-nineteen twenties during the Great Depression. The{Brinsop Arms}has been greatly altered during the last five years, having extended into the adjacent cottages to make it an attractive bar restaurant. The{Royal Oak}public house dates back to the eighteenth century when it was a coaching inn on the {Manchester/Preston}road. It has recently been renovated and has lost much of its 'olde worlde' charm. {Brinsop Hall Farm}works to conserve{ {butterflies,}buying them in the chrysalis stage and releasing them in a nearby meadow.
